newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia to launch debut Eurobond in November.
newsitem.headline: Russia to launch debut Eurobond in November.

text.p: Russia plans to issue its first Eurobond in November and will soon start a road-show for it in major financial centres, a finance ministry official said on Tuesday.

Vladimir Dmitriyev, deputy head of the foreign credit department, told Reuters that November was the most likely time for the Eurobond issue as markets would be closed for much of December for the Christmas and New Year holidays.
"But for us it is not necessary to launch the bond at any price this year, but to choose the right time for it," he said.
Previously government officials had said the Eurobond would be launched at the end of October or start of November.
Last month Russia received better-than-expected credit ratings paving the way for the Eurobond issue.
A November launch for the Eurobond could coincide with a heart operation for President Boris Yeltsin, scheduled for mid-November.
